subject: Using the class constructor to create mock ups
msgSnippet: Hey everyone, I have sent some questions regarding how to test methods using whole OR-mapped classes in a bundle. I got some very useful tips. However, I
messageBody:
Hey everyone,

I have sent some questions regarding how to test methods using whole
OR-mapped classes in a bundle. I got some very useful tips. However, I
looked again at the mock up proposal.

My ORM classes provide a constructor which assigns every class field a
variable. So I came to the point to use: new
Course(2,5,0,null,null,null,null,roomList); This means I set every value
I will not need for my test case to null.

Is this also a way to create mock up objects? Because implementing real
mock ups with a factory method and replacing its content like its
proposed in a paper from IBM, seems a bit overloaded if I can use the
constructor only.

Am I on the right path?

Best regards,
Konrad Reiche
